Elliotte Harold wrote:
> Ilja Preuss wrote:
> 
>  > Sorry, I don't understand this. How do you enforce the constraints in 
> code?
> 
> e.g.
> 
> if (argument > maximum_allowed_value) {
>    throw new IllegalArgumentException("Parameter too large");
> }
> 
> Obviously you can change the test condition and the exception to match
> the circumstance. Some public methods will accept any possible value of
> the expected type for their argument, and don't need any constraint
> checking.  Most will have restrictions, however.

I use Contract Tests (which I used to call Abstract Test Cases, but that 
old name doesn't reveal intent) to enforce these restrictions. If you 
implement me, you'd better pass my Contract Tests, or you don't really 
implement me. If the above example were really important, there'd be a test.
